title: Further Decimating the Inductive Programming Search Space with Instruction Digrams. (arXiv:2305.13347v1 [cs.PL])
abstract: Overlapping instruction subsets derived from human originated code have previously been shown to dramatically shrink the inductive programming search space, often by many orders of magnitude. Here we extend the instruction subset approach to consider direct instruction-instruction applications (or instruction digrams) as an additional search heuristic for inductive programming. In this study we analyse the frequency distribution of instruction digrams in a large sample of open source code. This indicates that the instruction digram distribution is highly skewed with over 93% of possible instruction digrams not represnted in the code sample. We demonstrate that instruction digrams can be used to constrain instruction selection during search, further reducing size of the the search space, in some cases by several orders of magnitude. This significantly increases the size of programs that can be generated using search based inductive programming techniques. We discuss the results and prov

Title: Further Decimating the Inductive Programming Search Space with Instruction Digrams. (arXiv:2305.13347v1 [cs.PL])
Abstract: Overlapping instruction subsets derived from human originated code have previously been shown to dramatically shrink the inductive programming search space, often by many orders of magnitude. Here we extend the instruction subset approach to consider direct instruction-instruction applications (or instruction digrams) as an additional search heuristic for inductive programming. In this study we analyse the frequency distribution of instruction digrams in a large sample of open source code. This indicates that the instruction digram distribution is highly skewed with over 93% of possible instruction digrams not represnted in the code sample. We demonstrate that instruction digrams can be used to constrain instruction selection during search, further reducing size of the the search space, in some cases by several orders of magnitude. This significantly increases the size of programs that can be generated using search based inductive programming techniques. We discuss the results and prov
translated_title: 基于指令二元组的归纳程序搜索空间再压缩
translated_abstract: 先前研究表明，从人类原创的代码中导出的重叠指令子集能够极大地缩小归纳编程的搜索空间，通常缩小几个数量级。本文将指令子集方法扩展到考虑指令-指令应用（或指令二元组）作为归纳编程的另一种搜索启发式。本研究分析了大量开源代码中指令二元组的频率分布，表明指令二元组分布极度偏斜，超过93%的指令二元组在代码样本中并未出现。我们演示了如何利用指令二元组在搜索过程中限制指令选择，进一步减小搜索空间的规模，在某些情况下减小了几个数量级。这大大增加了使用基于搜索的归纳编程技术生成程序的规模。我们讨论了结果和相关工作。
tldr: 本文通过研究大量开源代码中指令二元组的频率分布，证明可以利用指令二元组限制指令选择从而减小搜索空间，从而提高归纳编程的效率。
en_tdlr: This paper demonstrates that using instruction digrams to constrain instruction selection during search can significantly reduce the search space and improve the efficiency of inductive programming, based on the analysis of the frequency distribution of instruction digrams in a large sample of open source code.
